column2: OKLAHOMA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: OK

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column6: work with
column8: replace

column2: 2. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column6: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.
column8: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.

column2: 3. Because many crashes happen when a vehicle is turning left, drivers should:
column4: yield to oncoming vehicles, bicyclists and pedestrians.
column6: slow down gradually while checking the rear view mirror.
column8: move into the left lane of a multilane road.

column2: 4. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column6: parking lights.
column8: emergency flashers.

column2: 5. When the road is slippery, you should:
column6: brake suddenly carefully.
column8: use your emergency or parking brake.
column10: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.

column2: 6. An orange triangle with red borders means:
column6: Yield
column8: Slow moving vehicle

column2: 7. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: No, never.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column10: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 8. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 9. Your brake lights tell other drivers that you:
column6: are making a turn.
column8: are changing lanes.

column2: 10. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column6: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
column8: only when slowing down.

column2: 11. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
column6: Turn off the ignition.
column8: Yield.

column2: 12. Drowsy drivers:
column4: are at risk of being involved in a crash.
column6: should drink coffee to stay awake.
column8: can stay awake by opening a window.

column2: 13. Drinking alcoholic beverages:
column6: slows your reaction time.
column8: gives you a feeling of false confidence.

column2: 14. After stopping for a school bus that is unloading children you should:
column6: wait at least 4 minutes.
column8: watch for children walking along the side of the road.

column2: 15. When driving, it is important to keep a space cushion _______ of your vehicle.
column4: only on the left and right side
column6: on all sides
column8: only in back

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column6: The road ahead curves right, then left
column8: Left turns are prohibited
column10: The road ahead curves left, then right

column2: 17. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column4: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.
column6: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column8: maintain your speed.
column10: stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.

column2: 18. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: You must pass the school bus.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: The bus is about to stop.

column2: 19. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.
column6: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column8: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column10: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.

column2: 20. This road sign warns drivers that:
column6: they are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column8: they cannot go straight ahead.
column10: the one-way street or roadway is about to change to two-way traffic.

column2: 21. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 22. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column6: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column8: pass the car on the left.
column10: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.

column2: 23. Which of the following may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
column6: A controlled substance, such as prescription medicines or illegal drugs.
column8: An inhalant, such as glue or paint.

column2: 24. Drivers are required to stop:
column4: when a traffic officer orders them to stop.
column6: where there is a red light.
column8: at an intersection with a stop sign.

column2: 25. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column6: the law.
column8: what is not allowed.
column10: that there's a school zone ahead.
